alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Brown; Nicollet (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 9:58AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Brown, Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. .Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall over the past week will cause the Minnesota River at New Ulm to rise above Minor flood stage late this weekend. The river is expected to continue to rise, nearing Moderate flood stage later this week. For the Minnesota River...including Montevideo, Dawson, Granite Falls HWY 212, Morton, New Ulm, Mankato, Henderson MN19, Jordan, Savage...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River At New Ulm. * WHEN...From Monday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 796.0 feet, Water impacts park land and boat launch access road is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 AM CDT Sunday, the stage was 797.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 803.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 800.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 804.2 feet on 09/29/2010. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
